content:
48. The order of events at the second coming of Christ will 
be that 
A. those who are alive will be caught up first 
before the dead will rise. 
B. the dead will rise first before the living are 
cought up 
C. the dead and the living will be caught up 
together 
D. only the dead will rise leaving behind those 
who are alive. 
49. Which of the following commandments is described by 
James as the royal law? 
A. You shall have no other gods before me 
B. You shall love the Lord your God with all your 
heart. 
C. You shall love your neighbour as yourself. 
D. You shall not covet your neighbour’s property. 
 
50. “If your enemy is hungry, feed him ...” 
This statement implies 
A. vengeance B. kindness 
C. forgiveness D. charity. 
 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1997  
 
 
1. In extolling the sovereignty of God, Amos contrasted 
Him with the Nile, which he described as 
A. rising and sinking 
B. drying and flooding 
C. the source of the waters of the sea 
D. the source of Egypt’s power. 
 
2. By keeping God’s covenant, the people of Israel 
would become 
A. the conquerors of nations 
B. a kingdom of priests to God 
C. the inheritors of the earth 
D. a nation where God would manifest Himself. 
 
3. According to Jeremiah, the vital element in the new 
covenant God would make with the Jews was that 
A. He would bless all nations through the Jews 
B. Man would be enable to keep God’s law 
C. salvation would come through a virgin’s seed 
D. the individual would be accountable before 
God. 
 
4. Joseph saw his rise to leadership position in Egypt 
in relation to his brothers as 
A. a proof of his superiority over them 
B. an opportunity to avenge their evil deeds 
C. a time to test their honesty 
D. a means of preserving their lives. 
 
5. ‘If you will go with me, I will go; but if you will not go 
with me, I will not go.’’’ 
In the statement above, ‘you’ refers to 
A. God   B.  Balaam C.   Deborah   D. Jael. 
 
6. The name Ichabod means 
A. without glory B. unfolding glory 
C. perpetual glory D. departed glory 
 
7. How did David perceive that his child from 
Bathsheba was dead? 
A. Bathsheba Iamented the loss of her child. 
B. He saw his servants whispering together. 
C. He received a message to that effect from joab. 
D. God revealed it to him through Nathan. 
 
8. ‘As one falls before the wicked you have fallen.’’ 
This is a part of David’s Lamentation over 
A. Abasalom B. Jonathan C. Abner D. Saul 
 
9. The mother of the living child asked Solomon to give 
the child to the other woman because 
A. killing the child would serve no useful purpose 
B. her heart yearned for the child 
C. she was confident that the king would ensure 
justice 
D. she believed the child would recognize her at 
maturity. 
10. Hosea’smatrimonial experience symbolizes God’s intention 
to 
A. reform Israel and make her greater 
B. review his covenant with Israel 
C. discipline Israel for her infidelity 
D. redeem Israel from her unfaithfulness 
 
11. The harlotry of Gomer is compared to Israel’s 
A. abandonment  of the ephod 
B. false n insincere sacrifices 
C. oppression  of the poor 
D. unfaithfulness to God. 
 
12. ‘Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts; the whole earth 
is full of his glory.”’ 
A. Solomon dedicated the temple 
B. Josiah completed his reformation 
C. Uzzia of Judah died 
D. David brought the ark to Jerusalem. 
 
13 “Hear the word of the LORD, you rulers of Sodom! Give 
ear to the teaching of our God, you people of Gomorrah! 
The nation referred to a Sodom and Gomorrah in the 
statement above is 
A. Israel    B.  Judah C.  Samaria D. Ephraim. 
 
14. Jeremiah was not anxious to accept God’s call to become 
a prophet because 
A. it was hazardous profession 
B. he knew that people would not listen to him 
C. he needed to know God more 
D. he was too young and inexperienced. 
 
15. The devil’s principal purpose for tempting Jesus Christ 
was to
